clues.ADAD: Babylonian god of storms and wind
clues.ADAM: Scottish architect who designed many public buildings in England and Scotland (1728-1792)
clues.AKA: as known or named at another time or place
clues.ALBERT: prince consort of Queen Victoria of England (1819-1861)
clues.ALCHEMIC: related to or concerned with alchemy
clues.ANE: used of a single unit or thing; not two or more
clues.ARIA: an elaborate song for solo voice
clues.ASP: of southern Europe; similar to but smaller than the adder
clues.ASS: a United States territory on the eastern part of the island of Samoa
clues.ATE: eat a meal; take a meal
clues.AWED: inspired by a feeling of fearful wonderment or reverence
clues.AZO: relating to or containing the ___ radical
clues.BRIE: soft creamy white cheese; milder than Camembert
clues.CORPSE: the dead body of a human being
clues.DAH: the longer of the two telegraphic signals used in Morse code
clues.DIRT: (of roads) not leveled or drained; unsuitable for all year travel
clues.ECT: the administration of a strong electric current that passes through the brain to induce convulsions and coma
clues.EDEN: a beautiful garden where Adam and Eve were placed at the Creation; when they disobeyed and ate the forbidden fruit from the tree of knowledge of good and evil they were driven from their paradise (the fall of man)
clues.EEG: a graphical record of electrical activity of the brain; produced by an electroencephalograph
clues.EER: at all times; all the time and on every occasion
clues.ELATERID: any of various widely distributed beetles
clues.ELL: an extension at the end and at right angles to the main building
clues.ERA: a major division of geological time; an era is usually divided into two or more periods
clues.ERICA: any plant of the genus Erica
clues.ETA: the 7th letter of the Greek alphabet
clues.GAL: a unit of gravitational acceleration equal to one centimeter per second per second (named after Galileo)
clues.GEM: a crystalline rock that can be cut and polished for jewelry
clues.GORSE: very spiny and dense evergreen shrub with fragrant golden-yellow flowers; common throughout western Europe
clues.GUSH: issue in a jet; come out in a jet; stream or spring forth
clues.HEMP: any plant of the genus Cannabis; a coarse bushy annual with palmate leaves and clusters of small green flowers; yields tough fibers and narcotic drugs
clues.HULL: United States diplomat who did the groundwork for creating the United Nations (1871-1955)
clues.ICU: a hospital unit staffed and equipped to provide intensive care
clues.IDO: an artificial language that is a revision and simplification of Esperanto
clues.IOTA: a tiny or scarcely detectable amount
clues.LEE: the side of something that is sheltered from the wind
clues.LIST: the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the vertical
clues.LOGINESS: a dull and listless state resulting from weariness
clues.NEAR: ____ in time or place or relationship
clues.NET: a goal lined with ___ting (as in soccer or hockey)
clues.ORE: a monetary subunit in Denmark and Norway and Sweden; 100 ___ equal 1 krona
clues.PANGA: a large heavy knife used in Central and South America as a weapon or for cutting vegetation
clues.PARE: decrease gradually or bit by bit
clues.PUSS: the tenth month of the Hindu calendar
clues.RADON: a radioactive gaseous element formed by the disintegration of radium; the heaviest of the inert gasses; occurs naturally (especially in areas over granite) and is considered a hazard to health
clues.RANEE: (the feminine of raja) a Hindu princess or the wife of a raja
clues.REORDER: make a new request to be supplied with
clues.SARI: a dress worn primarily by Hindu women; consists of several yards of light material that is draped around the body
clues.SKATE: sports equipment that is worn on the feet to enable the wearer to glide along and to be propelled by the alternate actions of the legs
clues.SPIC: (ethnic slur) offensive term for persons of Latin American descent
clues.SUE: institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against
clues.TAHINI: a thick Middle Eastern paste made from ground sesame seeds
clues.TIB: a unit of information equal to 1024 gibibytes or 2^40 (1,099,511,627,776) bytes
clues.TOR: a prominent rock or pile of rocks on a hill
clues.UNARM: take away the weapons from; render harmless
clues.USE: (economics) the utilization of economic goods to satisfy needs or in manufacturing
